arts.ttl: Roma’s De Rossi: “This team must fight for the Champions League”
arts.sum: Following Roma’s 1-1 draw against Genoa, where Dovbyk’s goal was matched by De Winter’s late equalizer, Roma’s manager Daniele De Rossi shared his thoughts in a post-match interview with Sky Sport. De Rossi began by analyzing the match: “We dominated the first half. In the second half, we dropped back a bit to be able to counter-attack. We made too many technical errors, and this gives confidence to your opponents.” The Roma coach continued: “It was the game we wanted to play. arts.ttl: Roma boss Daniele de Rossi after draw against Genoa: “This team must fight for the Champions League”

arts.ttl: De Rossi Laments Late Mistakes as Roma Held to 1-1 Draw by Genoa
arts.sum: Daniele De Rossi concedes Roma made 'too many' mistakes in the second half as Genoa pegged them back late in a 1-1 draw. Artem Dovbyk's first goal in Serie A put the Giallorossi in front before halftime, but Koni De Winter's last-gasp equalizer condemned the visitors to a four-game winless league start. arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa – Roma: Match Report
arts.sum: Genoa snatched a late 1-1 draw against Roma, denying new coach Daniele De Rossi his first victory at the helm of the Giallorossi. The match began with promise for Roma when Artem Dovbyk scored his debut goal for the club. The Ukrainian striker’s tally came after a lengthy VAR review, which ultimately ruled in favor of the visitors. Roma dominated much of the first half, with Manu Koné, making his first start, coming close to doubling the lead. Genoa goalkeeper Pierluigi Gollini was kept busy, making several crucial saves to keep his team in the game.
